text: Cranberry Township is a town in Butler County, Pennsylvania. 33,096 people lived there in 2020. ==Surrounding neighborhoods== Cranberry Township has seven borders, including Jackson Township to the north, Forward Township at its northeast corner, Adams Township to the east, Seven Fields to the southeast, Pine Township and Marshall Township to the south, and New Sewickley Township to the west. == References == Category:Townships in Pennsylvania
title: Cranberry Township, Butler County, Pennsylvania
